title: Bus people
subject_group: Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Poverty - Australia
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Poverty - Children
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Poor - Australia
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Poor
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Melbourne (Vic.) - Social conditions
abstract: 'I was so poor, that I walked everywhere. The bus was a luxury.'
description: When you're poor, there's nothing as important as finding food. Nicole Bloom movingly recalls her distressing time on the streets, amongst the poor people of Melbourne, when riding on the bus is a luxury.
part_of_compliation_title_or_vod_package: Compilation title; B2002303; Digital Storytelling workshop : general public (March 2009); Active; 2009
